metadata.title: CVE-2020-14641 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Security: Roles). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.20 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored. mdeslaur> 8.x only

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.21-0ubuntu3').
